Daly_City.Recreation Park (San Francisco):
Recreation Park was the name applied to several former baseball parks in San Francisco, California in the late 19th Century and early 20th Century.
Recreation Grounds, opening on November 26, 1868 and operated until May 1884, and was San Francisco's first professional enclosed ballpark. Located at the terminus of a railcar line in San Francisco's heavily Irish Mission District, at the present day Garfield Square.
